The Jerusalem Embassy Act of 1995: which mandated the move of the American embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, was passed by an overwhelming bipartisan majority in Congress.
The Jerusalem Embassy Act was reaffirmed: indicating ongoing support for the law.
The 2017 Senate resolution commemorating: 4. The Senate resolution also reaffirmed the longstanding, bipartisan policy of the United States government that the permanent status of Jerusalem remains a matter to be decided between the parties through final status negotiations towards a two-state solution.
